snippet: Officials in Las Cruces, N.M., transformed an encampment in a dangerous part of the city into a hub of services for homeless people.
abstract: Las Cruces, NM, officials are making exception to zoning laws, letting almost 50 homeless people live in Hope City, tent encampment on city-owned property; camp has become transformative force and bringing homeless closer to social services, and hopes of permanent homes.
lead_paragraph: Officials in Las Cruces, N.M., transformed an encampment in a dangerous part of the city into a hub of services for homeless people.

headline.main: In New Mexico Tent City, a Glimmer of Hope
headline.print_headline: In Tent City, a Glimmer of Hope
